Rebirth: return to Mentor
The very day you have been waiting for has arrived. Pass through the thorns and the Monolith will give you what you have desired.
My brother, why have you come here?
To fulfill my innermost desire.

That very desire is the lifeblood of the brotherhood. The Monolith has changed. Now, the brotherhood is supported only by a number of zealots. Many former fighters of ours deserted us after the shutdown of the Brain Scorcher. Some have remained simply because they would die outside the brotherhood, but this does not mean that they will not leave sooner or later. And some, like the two of us, have stayed here because we want to build our own personal paradise; with the technologies of the C-Consciousness, that is a concrete possibility.
When will we be able to bring our dream to fruition?

All in due time, my brother. Remember that your old life is coming to an end. Over time, the brotherhood has decreased in numbers but increased in fervour. What you will be experiencing here will, to any objectively normal person, seem a true horror. To begin with, I want to observe your willpower. I want you to put an end to the pseudogiant roaming around in this city, without the use of your current equipment. However you manage to accomplish the objective—with your bare hands, with the help of your fellow brothers, or with the help of any weaponry you might find—is of no matter to me. You will reveal to yourself what you are capable of for the sake of achieving your goal and what means you will end up resorting to. Now, be on your way!
Understood.
The creature is no more. I wonder why we destroy them when they may prove useful against the infidels?

The C-Consciousness is weak. Now, it is not enough to keep even a handful of people in check… At this time, mutants have no place amongst our forces. Nonetheless, admirable work. Your possessions are in the blue box in the other room. When you’re ready for the next challenge, return to me.

Rebirth: speak to Mentor
Rebirth: kill the prisoners
Rebirth: speak to Mentor
I don’t know what will happen this time.
What is my next test?
Come with me.
You see these men? Seal their fate. Prove your loyalty to our cause… without a shadow of a doubt.
Very well.
Well done. These men were soldiers of Freedom, presumably scouts; we will establish why they were here. I will contact you later and we shall decide our next move.
Understood.
Rebirth: go to the Radar
Rebirth: speak to the leader of Wings
Mentor has informed you of a squad in need of assistance in the Radar.
What do you require of me?
Enemies have spotted activity of our patrols at the Radar and the edges of Pripyat. I want you to decide on how we should deal with the matter. This will test your mental abilities.
We need to commence an attack on their nearest foothold: the Barrier. Their further scouting efforts will be hampered.
We should set out to find the rest of the reconnaissance group; they may have split up.
In that case, you should head out at once. We shall we how you will handle this, as you have suggested yourself. We have no other soldiers to send with you, but you may have a few grenades.

A wise decision. However, a new enemy development has come to our attention. According to the PDA conversations of the Freedom scouts, one of our own has been distributing Monolithian armour to enemy actors. We can handle the remaining scouts; I need you to take care of the traitor. I’ve called the recruits back to the base to speak with me. They know that I want to have a stern talk with each of them; I would like you gauge what they suspect our conversation would be about.
Mentor:\nI have some additional work for you to do, zealot.

Mentor:\nDone? Too bad I didn’t see his face at that moment, ha-ha! Now, head to the Radar; our reconnaissance team has moved in there. The Wings squad is waiting for you. See the commander, Griffin, he will set things into motion with your help.
Rebirth: clear out the Barrier
Rebirth: return to the Radar
Rebirth: speak to Griffin, the leader of Wings
Me and my big mouth… They gave me grenades, though.
Cease your attack and return to the Radar. Our fighters need help. Speak to Griffin; he runs the Wings detachment.
Rebirth: speak to the first brother
Rebirth: speak to the second brother
Rebirth: speak to the third brother
Rebirth: speak to the fourth brother
Rebirth: share insights with Mentor
You need to mine the recruits for information to root out the traitor in our midst. Suspicion is to be avoided.
You must be the one Mentor sent. Are you ready to march with us through the skeleton of a once great laboratory?
Are you part of Wings? What are we doing here?

That we are… or more precisely, what is left of them. I’m Griffin, and the other guys go by Sparrow and Pegasus. The guy with the SVD is Wind. So, listen up: at one time, there were a lot of men in our unit. Our might was something for all the heretics to fear… that was, until some stalker sabotaged the local ‘brainwashing facility’. The ensuing firefight had to be witnessed to be believed: Duty, Freedom, the loners, and the military, assaulting us all at once. Our unit was thrashed, and not even our best members survived the battle. But still: even now, nobody has managed to take control of this area. I don’t know what happened here, but the area’s completely infested by walking corpses and all kinds of nasty creatures.
So, what is our mission?

Our goal is to try to regain control of this area; we need to head into the bunker under the Brain Scorcher and assess the situation. One of the most important factors in regaining our foothold in the region will be whether or not we can reactivate the installation. Once you’re ready to go, let me know. We need every man we can get on this mission, so we’ll head out on your word.
I’m ready. Let’s go.
I’m not ready yet.
Griffin:\nWe need to get into the very end of the complex. Careful, who knows what might be hiding in these shadows?…
Griffin:\nHere’s the control room… It must’ve seen better days. Men, let’s discuss our next steps.
What now?
Keep this place protected while I try to figure out what’s going on here. We’re probably going to have a few visitors.
What does it look like?

Currently, nothing. Some low-life came and scrapped the control panel for materials to sell off, but that’s just half of it: the cooling system is bust, and any other damages I’ll have to inspect further some other time. I doubt that my efforts here will be enough… but that’s nothing you need to worry about at the moment. Hey, have you been assigned to any detachment yet?
Not really. Mentor has ordered us to respond to any incoming messages, but that’s all we’ve got.
I think there might be a spot for you in Wings; I can see that there’s some potential in you. I want to express my gratitude on behalf of the whole group for the help, you’ve really saved our asses.
It was no problem at all, brother.
I’ll report back to base. See our supplier in Pripyat; he’ll give you your reward. You’ll be in for a pleasant surprise. By the way, fighter… I hope to see you in our ranks sometime soon.
I heard that I was supposed to receive something from Wings.
You heard correctly. Here’s your Abakan.
That’s correct. If you were able to earn Griffin’s respect, I think you’ll make it quite far. Here, have the company’s squad uniform.
Rebirth: speak to Mentor
Rebirth: assault the laundromat
Rebirth: speak to Inquisitor
The laundromat needs to be cleared of infidels.
What task have you got, Mentor?
You will have to seize a stalker base in the outskirts. Our brothers believe that they will be an interference in our plans and a threat to the brotherhood as a whole.
Am I going there on my own?

No, you are not. You will meet with another group of ours serving as assault troops. I give newcomers an opportunity to spend some time with two different groups so that it will be easier for them to determine their own place in the brotherhood. A shame that the third group has been taken out, though… Now, finish your task.
We did well. Mentor has told me that I am at your disposal from now on.

You really did help us! At last, Mentor has started recruiting stronger men. Keep your equipment in good condition and have some rest. Once you’re ready, you may head to our base at the CNPP. We’ll continue making preparations here, and I’ll contact you once we’re done.
Understood.
Head to the sarcophagus
Find all possible information about the Crystal group
Return to Inquisitor
Inquisitor has asked you to learn more about the once-legendary team of defenders of the Monolith and report back any information about them.
Mentor mentioned a third detachment that was wiped out. Who did he have in mind?
The Crystal group. At one point, it was our most powerful force, tasked to protect the C-Consciousness and the sarcophagus along with all the surrounding areas.
But what happened?

I’m sure you know by know, but some bastard or group of bastards managed to shut down the Brain Scorcher: the great barrier between Pripyat and the rest of the Zone. Then came the military and all kinds of tourists with their shiny new stalker suits, along with every other group under the sun. I don’t remember a lot about it, as I was on a mission with Preacher at the time… but I digress. Crystal held out until their last breath, but I think you understand their fate by now. You should rummage through the sarcophagus and see if you can get some more details of what went down from their PDAs… or even a weapon, since I’m sure they’re not using them anymore. Just make sure you bring something to deal with the radiation.
Perhaps I’ll go. I’m interested in the fate of the group.
Too dangerous for me.
Here, take it. Most of the information is lost, and the rest of it I can’t read.
I’ll tell Mentor, he’ll do it later. That’s really a pity.
Why did you decide to stay in the brotherhood? As I understand it, you used to be zombified.

I woke up somewhere near Pripyat, surrounded by people I did not know and nothing else, as they did not remember either. We were united only by uniform, and still we did not betray each other. My old life was left behind, my brother… It just so happened, and nothing can be done to fix it. After inspecting my rifle, I found twenty-two incisions on it. I don’t think I’d be accepted anywhere else.
Inquisitor:\nWe’re commencing the attack. Come on.
Destroy the bandit base
Cold has tasked you with clearing out the main bandit foothold in the Great Swamps.

This needs to be done before morning, since that’s when all of those bastards are cosy in their camp. I’ve gathered a squad of strong men to get even with the thugs at their home base in the fishing hamlet, and I would like you to go with them. There’s only one thing: don’t ditch the guys. If someone gets killed, I won’t forgive you.
Thank you. This is from me. You are worthy to wear this uniform.
Eliminate the objective
A threat must be taken care of.
I have something that needs taking care of. If you’re willing to go, I’ll mark it on your PDA.
Thank you, here’s your reward.
Kill the black chimera
The hidden base of Clear Sky must be saved from imminent danger.
Basically, the situation’s dire. Near the tower in the south-west of the swamps, some monster has settled and is attacking under the cloak of night. You’ll have to head over there and deal with it.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart, brother.
Salutations, fellow brother. My duty is to provide technical support for our brethren in the area.
Find %s
The technician at the depot has asked you to retrieve %s.
Our base was set up here recently, but the lack of tools for our brothers has been acute. Will you find a set of basic tools for the benefit of the brotherhood? It would be invaluable.
Our base was set up here recently, but the lack of tools for our brothers has been acute. Will you find a set of basic tools for the benefit of the brotherhood? It would be invaluable.
Excellent. This will help us gain a foothold and grow in strength. I believe you deserve a discount.
Find %s
The technician at the depot has asked you to retrieve %s.

Fighting has shown that our weapons are marginally inferior to those of the infidels, among which exist capable technicians. I require tools for fine work to save our brothers from such inferiorities. Will you help, brother?

Fighting has shown that our weapons are marginally inferior to those of the infidels, among which exist capable technicians. I require tools for fine work to save our brothers from such inferiorities. Will you help, brother?
Good work. The equipment supplied to our brothers will prove to be dominant over all others in the area. You will be getting an additional reduction in fees.
Find %s
The technician at the depot has asked you to retrieve %s.
We will be able to surpass them all, brother! To accomplish that, I require tools for calibrating our weapons. Please, locate a set and bring it to me.
We will be able to surpass them all, brother! To accomplish that, I require tools for calibrating our weapons. Please, locate a set and bring it to me.
It is settled. With these recent discoveries, we shall conquer the surrounding areas. From here on out, my services for you will be provided to the best of my capability.
Greetings, brother. I strive for victory over the infidels by maintaining the equipment of our brotherhood.
Find %s
The technician in the Yubileiny service centre has asked you to retrieve %s.
I need your help, brother. I require tools for our equipment so that our brethren may spread the word of the Monolith more effectively.
I need your help, brother. I require tools for our equipment so that our brethren may spread the word of the Monolith more effectively.
Excellent work, brother. Everything we gain from future improvements will go to our charity, and your contribution will grant you a small discount.
Find %s
The technician in the Yubileiny service centre has asked you to retrieve %s.

The set of tools you located previously does not suffice. Finer tools are required for more extensive work so that our brethren may continue spreading their march to victory. Will you serve our cause once again?

The set of tools you located previously does not suffice. Finer tools are required for more extensive work so that our brethren may continue their march to victory. Will you serve our cause once again?
Excellent work, brother. Everything we gain from future improvements will go to our charity, and your contribution will grant you an additional discount.
Find %s
The technician in the Yubileiny service centre has asked you to retrieve %s.

The last set of tools that you brought here was… adequate, but why stop at what has been achieved when we can attain something even better? What we need are the best tools in the Zone. I ask of you to serve our cause one last time, my brother.

The last set of tools that you brought here was… adequate, but why stop at what has been achieved when we can attain something even better? What we need are the best tools in the Zone. I ask of you to serve Its will one last time, my brother.
Outstanding work, brother. Rest assured, I will mention your contribution to our brothers, and I promise to provide any assistance within my ability.
Are you waiting for someone?

Oh, hey! Wouldn’t happen to need the services of a humble guide, would you? I can take you to the rookie village in the Cordon, the… ‘hidden’ base in the Great Swamps, and the flea market in the Garbage.
Remind me, where do your routes lead?
One thousand roubles will lead you to the rookie village in the Cordon. For twenty-five hundred, I can get you to the hidden base in the Great Swamp or the flea market in the Garbage.
Who are you?

I’m a guide, they call me Leopard. As you can see, this place is surrounded by all sorts of danger, but we’ve got an underground sewer network that not many know of, with the fortunate exception of yours truly. We can get you out of the city to one of two bases: the waste processing station in Zaton, or our outpost by the bridge in the Red Forest.
Remind me, where do your routes lead?
You don’t have too many options: there’s the waste processing station in southern Zaton and our outpost by the bridge in the Red Forest. Eight thousand and twenty-five thousand, respectively.
Are you a guide?

Yep. Navigator’s the name. Can take you to a few places for a modest fee. Rookies are my customers most of the time, but I can lead any experienced stalker as well. No shame in that. I’ll break it down: you pay, I get you wherever you want to go, and I return here. I can take you to one of six locations: Yantar, the Great Swamps, the army warehouses, the Garbage, the Cordon, and Jupiter.
Sorry, where can you escort me?

To the the Garbage for seven hundred, the army warehouses for one thousand, the Rookie Village in the Cordon for three thousand, Yantar for thirty-five hundred, Yanov station in Jupiter for six thousand, and the Great Swamps, also for six thousand.
Who have we got here?

You blind or something? I’m the local guide here. If you need my help, I can drop you at quite a few places, such as our encampment in the truck cemetery or our warehouse in Jupiter. It’ll cost ya, though!
Remind me which paths you take.
The Garbage, twenty-five hundred; the truck cemetery, twenty-five hundred; the Cordon, four thousand; and Jupiter, eight thousand. All that territory’s ours, ha-ha!
Who are you?

Nice to meet you, mate. Name’s Garry, and I’m a guide. Usually roam around the centre of the Zone. I can take you to the Bar, Pripyat and its outskirts, the Red Forest, Zaton, and the Jupiter Underground.
Forgot. Where can you lead me?

I can offer trips to the Bar for six thousand roubles, Pripyat for three thousand and its outskirts for four thousand, the Red Forest for twenty-five hundred, the Skadovsk in Zaton for two thousand, and the Jupiter Underground for fifteen hundred.
To which places may I travel to, brother?

There are several. We have routes that lead to the Red Forest, the outskirts, and central Pripyat itself. I cannot take you to any of these locations myself, but you may go with your brothers. I don’t believe you’ll find that a problem.
Where can the guides take me?
To the Red Forest for six thousand roubles, the outskirts for two thousand, and Pripyat for one thousand.
Is there anywhere I may travel, brother?

Certainly. I may ask our brothers to lead you in exchange for a donation to the brotherhood. You may be taken to the outskirts of Pripyat east of here, to Jupiter to the west, and to the Red Forest located to the south-west.
To which places may I travel to, brother?
There are ways to the outskirts east of here and Jupiter to the west. Both will cost you one thousand roubles.
Hey, why are you standing there?

Well, there’s no time for me to sit around! Gotta be aware of the surrounding area, considering I’m the local guide. If you’ve got the money, there are a few places in the Swamps I can guide you to: the observation post, the water pump station, or the machine yard. I can also take you on a trip to the rookie village in the Cordon. If you’ve gone completely bonkers, Agroprom is another option, and if you’re in a good mood, there’s also the Bar!
Can you name your routes again?

These are the routes I take: the observation outpost for three hundred roubles, the pump station and the old church both for five hundred, the machine yard for eight hundred, the rookie village in the Cordon for fifteen hundred, Agroprom for two thousand, and the Bar for four thousand.
Where do you travel to again?

To the nuclear power plant for twelve thousand roubles, Pripyat for three thousand, Yanov station in Jupiter for four thousand, the Radar for eight thousand, the Jupiter Underground for just one thousand, and Zaton, via Garry, for four thousand.
To which places may I travel to, brother?
For your money, the brothers may be your guides. You may be escorted to Jupiter and central Pripyat; come to us at any time for our services.
Where can the guides take me?
To Jupiter for two thousand roubles. They may also guide you to Pripyat for a mere sum of one thousand.
To which places may I travel to, brother?
I cannot escort you personally, but our brothers may show you where to go for a fee. We’ve got positions set up in the Red Forest, Jupiter, and Pripyat. We would be glad to assist you at any time.
Where can the guides take me?
To the outskirts of Pripyat for five thousand roubles, Jupiter for six thousand, and central Pripyat for five thousand.
You look like an interesting character.

Pathfinder Pilot at your service. There aren’t many places I can take you, but it’ll definitely be much faster and safer than travelling alone. I offer services to Pripyat and its outskirts via fellow guide Garry, though I can take you to Jupiter myself.
Give me your travel list again.
I can talk to Garry about getting you to Pripyat for four thousand, as well as the outskirts for five thousand. I can lead you to Yanov station in Jupiter by myself for two thousand.
Who are you?

The local cook, I guess. I can’t even make something simple like an omelette, but somehow, that’s the assigned role I received in the army. I’m not a real soldier, so they put me here in Yantar… Anyway, they call me Rookie; not far from the truth. Usually, I take to drinking because it’s so depressing around here. If that ain’t enough, this is the main base of the scientists, meaning my officers come here for inspections from time to time, and they don’t really fancy seeing alcohol… Last time they were here, they poured my vodka out right before my eyes. Bastards.
Go on.

Well, I know that getting ammo around here is rough, especially when Sakharov doesn’t even sell any. I can hook you up with some stuff, but only Soviet-era shite, unfortunately. I’ve also got a few outfits; everything I’ve managed to steal is mine. What do you say about trading with me for a few bottles of Cossacks? For five bottles, I can offer you six mags of 9x18, or three mags of 5.45. For ten bottles, I can share six mags of 5.45, two mags of 7.62, or five packs of 12x70 buckshot rounds. For fifteen bottles and seven thousand roubles, I can get you five box mags for the PKP, and for twenty bottles, I’ll fetch you an entire Berill suit from the bins… Don’t think I’m a scoundrel. It’s not that bad, and the lion’s share goes to the guys. They’ve left me their equipment in a stash. I’ll leave any goods between the hangars outside the bunker.
I’ll consider it. Thank you.
Remind me, what do you have?

This is what I’ve got: for five bottles, I can get you six mags of 9x18, or three mags of 5.45. For ten bottles, I can get you either six 5.45 mags, two mags of 7.62, or five packs of 12x70 buckshot. For fifteen bottles and a decent sum of seven thousand roubles, I can get you five box mags for the PKP… and for twenty bottles, I’ll get you an entire Berill.
I’ve brought some vodka.
Oh, finally… something to drink. Is there anything particular you want?
Six mags of 9x18.
Three 5.45 mags.
Six 5.45 mags.
Some buckshot shells.
Two mags of 7.62.
Five boxes for the PKP.
The Berill suit.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve changed my mind.
Greetings. What do you do?

I could ask you a reasonable question in return: ‘What’s your bloody business?’ But that’s not what you wanna hear, is it? I work as a trader and guide, and I know routes to our head base in the Dead City, along with our main outpost in the Red Forest.
Could you remind me where your routes lead?
Two routes, pal. The Dead City for eight grand, and the Red Forest for two and a half.
Find %s
Griffin has asked you to retrieve %s.

There are just too many of those goddamn fanatics. Could you wipe them out? I’ve got a little something that could help you out in future hunts. It’s yours if you bring me twenty-five of their patches.

There are just too many of those goddamn fanatics. Could you wipe them out? I’ve got a little something that could help you out in future hunts. It’s yours if you bring me twenty-five of their patches.
Thanks, stalker. Here’s that little toy I promised you.
Find a Soul artefact
Griffin has asked you to locate and return a Soul artefact.

There’s no doctor here, and we’ve got to survive somehow. Ordinary medical equipment just isn’t enough for us, and not many of the men know how to use it properly. It’s hard enough taking care of everyone around here. So, I want to ask for your help. I’ve heard about an artefact called the Soul, said to have an ability to heal the wounds of people. Could you find one and bring it here for us?
You actually found one? I can’t believe it… Thank you, stalker! This will help the others. And don’t go without your reward.
Clean out the grocery store
The mercenaries want the dogs at the nearest grocery store taken care of.

We’ve got another problem. There are dogs who have settled down at the grocery store, and that’s no good for us. They’ve been barking at us nonstop, and that draws unwanted attention. I’d appreciate it if you could clear them out from that place.
Great work. Here’s some money for your trouble.
Find %s
The mercenary squad stuck in Pripyat require %s.
Yes, I have a list of the most important things that I need. In particular, ammunition, repair kits, and medical supplies. Can you help us?
I have a laundry list of stuff that I need: in particular, ammunition, repair kits, and medical supplies. I’m set on those for now, and I still need %s. Can you do it?
Thank you.
Climb on the roof of the water tower
Wait an hour for the download to start
Go back to Ganja
Ganja has asked you to climb to the roof of the water tower in order to download some ‘entertainment data’ for Freedom.

Oh, mate, glad you asked… Listen, as you know, we’ve got an internet network around these parts, but its range is bloody terrible. Usually, we have someone climb the water tower in the bloodsucker village and download all the good stuff for the guys, ’cause the speed there is pretty great. Just this time, could you be the one going up there? I’ve already opened the right program on this laptop, you just have to download the stuff for us. Will you help?
Thanks, brother! If you enjoyed it, you can come back later. Getting to the top of that tower is basically a hobby of ours, heh.
Freedom laptop

A laptop shared among members of Freedom, used for recreational purposes. There are several copies of social network pages, music, various video games, movies ranging from art films to more recent blockbusters, photos of carriers of this information… and, of course: videos, pictures, and drawings of pornographic nature.
Hey, what’s up?
Nothing much, just lazing around. I’m Leshiy, the local guide and scout.
And how’s the local intelligence? I presume you’ve visited many places?
Indeed. I’ve even been in an anomaly. Entered a spatial bubble with my squad back when I was a mercenary. It’s a long story. Anyway, if you need to travel somewhere, you can talk to me.
I’ll keep that in mind.
So where can you lead me?
On my list is Yanov for six grand, the Cordon village for forty-five hundred, and Yantar for five grand.
Lead me somewhere.
Sure, man. Where to?
Need the money first, pal.
Here, all yours.
Got the money?
Here, keep it.
Did you bring the money?
Of course. Here.
Forgot it.
I’ve changed my mind.
I need medical assistance.
Huh? Right, come on over. My price is two thousand. Hope you’ve got that much.
Nope. Ain’t got nothing.
You’re healthier than my buddy Vitka, boyo… and that rawny ponce is a drug addict!
Here.
This might sting a bit… Right, you take care now.
Defeat the Duty soldiers in the village
Mikluha has planned on how to discourage Duty from going to the village near the path to Rostok once and for all, in which he has given you a central role.

Oh, fighter, hello! There’s a delicate matter for us to handle. Do you know that village on the way to Rostok that Dutyers have been squatting in for years? No? Basically, I had an idea of how to discourage them from coming there once and for all: we need to flaunt our tactics to intimidate them, make them think twice about coming back. Some fresh forces just arrived there, I really don’t know why they are there, but if we defeat them with half their number, imagine how much pressure it’ll put on them! Well, are you interested?

Outstanding work, fighter! Take this rifle. Don’t look upset; it’s a good shooter, and while it certainly isn’t fit for, say, the open spaces of the army warehouses, it should come in useful at some point and time… he-he.
Find four Veles-class detectors
Miklukha has complained that the level of technical support of the group leaves much to be desired. They require four Veles detectors.

Oh, you’re just in time; my men rarely drop by to work, but, alas, I can’t blame them for that. If you don’t know, back in the old days with Lukash, Cook, and the other cockeyed personalities, our level of material security was negligible, and now, under the new leadership, even less than that. I want to bring back the tradition of gathering artefacts to fit people’s needs, but we possess only a couple of Veles-class detectors, one of which is broken. I need four of these detectors, and I’ll pay five grand for each. You in?

Oh, you’re just in time; my men rarely drop by to work, but, alas, I can’t blame them for that. If you don’t know, back in the old days with Lukash, Cook, and the other cockeyed personalities, our level of material security was negligible, and now, under the new leadership, even less than that. I want to bring back the tradition of gathering artefacts to fit people’s needs, but we possess only a couple of Veles-class detectors, one of which is broken. I need four of these detectors, and I’ll pay five grand for each. You in?
Thank you. Take your money.
Unremarkable chimney top
Worn notebook
A notebook, likely owned by Strelok himself. Inside are scribbled details on how to get into an underground complex by the name of X-18.
Transceiver
An old model of an army transceiver, used to transmit and receive information.
This box is locked.
Wings of the Monolith

A variant of the standard Monolith suit, providing a lighter load and additional comfort unlike its predecessor. Tailored to address the new challenges of the brotherhood, it offers enhanced protection from radiation and psi-emissions while still remaining lightweight.
How are you doing?
Mmm… A bit uneasy, mate, but that’s normal when you’re in new places, right?… I heard that Mentor asked to speak with us.
I’ve heard that too. What are your thoughts on it?

I’m afraid of failing my very first trial. Is this some prank to get me to step into an anomaly? I think he’s worrying about me bringing the wrong artefact, or not getting any artefact at all… Gods. I’m sorry, brother. I need some space to think.
Hey. Have you heard that Mentor’s calling us one by one?
Yeah, I’ve heard, but why one by one? I don’t think that’s normal.
How do you feel about this place?
Don’t get me started. I don’t want to rant about it. I’m preparing for my third test, if you’ll excuse me.
The tension around the base is making me uncomfortable, brother. Care to talk?
Why not? How are you faring?
Everything is fine. I’m under the wing of those who will bring my dream to fruition.
And what is your dream?
If I’m going to be chatting about my dream in every one of my encounters, it becomes a purpose and not a dream. What are you here for?

I’m in it for the money, mostly. What else does any stalker dream of?… Anyway, you certainly seem like a good man, but I’d like take some time to rest on my thoughts. I’ve already heard so many things today.
Greetings. I’m waiting for Mentor to call me in, and I’ve been trying to get to know my fellow brothers in the meantime. What is your story?

You know, I used to be an experienced loner, and throughout travels, I had heard stories of the Monolith’s power, like a child’s tale. Ever since then, I’ve dreamed about joining them. I’ve almost made it. Once I pass my final test, I will be a member of the brotherhood and have finally accomplished my dream.
And what do you desire from the brotherhood?

I desire nothing more than to give myself to the Monolith. There is nobody waiting for me on the mainland, and no life outside of the Zone interests me in any way. The power that we wield is the most important in the world. Now… I must meditate. We can speak another time.
I believe I have identified the spy.
Go ahead.
I believe it was the first member I spoke to. He was very nervous when I spoke to him.
It may be the second one I talked to. He seems reclusive, he might be hiding something from us.
I think it was the third recruit I met. He said that he came here for the money and couldn’t come up with any better reason for being here than greed.
The fourth member. His responses seemed too well-rehearsed, like he was prepared for an interrogation.

Your investigative skills are lacking. No matter, though; this was just a test. I had an assistant shadow you while you spoke to the recruits and take care of the traitor. You will not be rewarded for failure, hopefully you will use some spare time to meditate on this experience and shore up your skills. When you are ready, head to the Radar and meet up with Griffin and the rest of Wings. They could use some assistance.

Impressive reasoning. Because this was a serious matter, I had an assistant shadow you during the interviews. Do not worry, the traitor has been dealt with. I have received word from Griffin that reinforcements are needed at the Radar. Head there and meet up Griffin and the rest of Wings. Take this shotgun. You have earned it, and it will surely come in handy.
Man, what the hell were you shooting for? You almost killed me!
And what are you here for? No bullshitting. Don’t waste my time.
Okay, easy. Just passing by. Need any help? Can you answer a few questions?
I’ll answer, but don’t screw around.
I have a couple of questions.
Yeah? Spill it.
Where did you get this dog?

That’s Lassie. A sweet little bitch… If not for her, I’d have been devoured in my sleep long ago. Cursed mutants… I hate them! Soon as you close your eyes, they start reaching for you with their nasty claws, fangs and feelers…
I see.
Where do those puppies come from if your pooch is next to you all the time? Heh.
Why do you live in this rubbish bin?
It’s the Ark! Remember that… you will, if you want to live! When a Wave starts, stay close. Here you’ll have a chance to survive. No mutant will ever break in here.
What ‘Wave’? What are you talking about?

The creatures are watching me day and night. You do not understand… those snorks from the southern plateau have followed me right up to the Ark! I’m an experienced hunter and I know that they would not have chased the victim for so damn long. Something isn’t clear… they must have a collective mind of sorts. My thoughts have been confirmed by the recent attacks on the barge by those horrors.
I guess anything can happen in the Zone, but if your estimates are correct, we’re in some deep trouble.
Why do you not trust people?
Because I’ve been through too much.
I think I’ll go.
This path is unknown
New path unlocked:

So, stalker, here’s the deal: to go further, you need to pay us five thousand, or we’ll drop you if you try to pass us without our dues. Our… ‘kindness’, will last exactly one hour. You have two choices: pay, or sod off.
Here are your dues.
Some other time, then.
Security chief’s records
A few company records filled with the names and pictures of all employees present at the beginning and end of work days. However, dates indicate that this complex was used after the first emission.
Production information
No details in these documents show any particular importance. Apparently, the efforts of this plant were mainly engaged in energy issues.
Accounting book

A book containing basic information on key individuals and the material structure of the new enterprise. The lion’s share of funds is earmarked, received from the state. No unusual content is located within, as it doesn’t deal the matter of armaments.
PDA of a dead stalker

The battery has been depleted, although a note hidden inside the battery compartment reads: ‘Stalker, if you are reading this, it’s best that you leave this place for good. If you came hoping to profit, you should know that there’s truly nothing here… although, by the time of discovering this PDA, you probably understand everything already. I don’t know if we’re going to survive this night… Everything’s so disgusting and terrifying. My mind feels like it’s open, as if something’s reading my thoughts and scoffing at me. I’m exhausted… My thoughts are blurring together… I think I’ll end this entry here.’
Destroy the enemy
A key position in the Zone must be liberated.
The element of surprise is one that can be wielded to great effect. Unleash your rage against our enemies and you will be rewarded.
Excellent. Have your due.
Find %s
Mentor has asked you to retrieve %s.
It’s time to make those bastards pay. Tear off their patches and bring them to me, and I’ll give you a bonus.
It’s time to make those bastards pay. Bring me %s and I’ll give you a bonus.
Outstanding, brother. This is for you, from the Monolith.
Fend off the zombie assault
Zombies are entering Pripyat from the Radar. You need to clear them away.
Zombies are coming in from the Radar. Last we heard, they were approaching from the south side of the city. We must clear the area of their pestilence. Are you willing to go?
Well done. Here is your reward.
Excuse me, Garik. I need to pass through.
Is there something in that room?

Not something, someone. That guy in there is a veteran, and he can get anyone any kind of equipment. Even unique stuff. He isn’t accepting any visitors, though; gotta make sure you’re trusted for that. Gonna need a name around here.
So, can I meet this man now?
Hm… Alright. I’ll let Garik know. The name of the guy is Nimble. Head straight and then right along the corridor.
Is there something in that room?

Not something, someone. That guy in there is a veteran, and he can get anyone any kind of equipment. Even unique stuff. If you want to see him, go ahead. I trust you. You can tell Garik you need to pass. Just head straight and then right down the corridor. His name is Nimble.
Is there any extra equipment for sale?
Certainly, but nobody right now will want to sell you any extra supplies. You’ll have to gain some trust and experience, and after that, you can buy equipment wholesale.
May I purchase additional equipment from you, brother?

You may, although not at this point in time. First, I must see to it that you continue to carry the will of the Monolith towards the infidel masses. We may talk about this transaction when you gain more experience.
Find the rookie’s weapon
A stalker by the name of Fatty wants his own shotgun retrieved for him.
What is it you wanted to offer me?

The whole factory that’s in the vicinity. You know, this place here certainly ain’t the nicest, but nobody here’s complaining, as, frankly, the artefacts here aren’t that common, and the dangers here are quite remarkable. But recently, rumours about the local factory started spreading, about some kind of weapon being created by the government in this place following the first Chernobyl disaster. You know the stories about the Marked One and Strelok, both almost completely having looted all of the underground complexes? There’s hope for beginners here; to get something valuable and dear without having to travel to the centre of the Zone. So they’ve pushed forward, and I’m one of them. Bandits have followed, because there are many stalkers out here, and there’s a lot of loot to grab.
So you want me come along and look for intelligence?

Yep. But you gotta help me with something, first. There’s no way to survive around here without a weapon. I used to have a good shotgun; grabbed it before I came here, but I went to the local substation not far from here, and there was a strange anomaly there… I got careless and got zapped! Fortunately, I wasn’t hurt, but I freaked out and threw the weapon, then ran away here. Laugh all you want, but when you escape death that narrowly… So, will you bring it to me? That’s… if you want to help me with something else afterwards.
Alright. I’ll go get your shotgun.
Not now.
Here’s your gun.
Thanks. Take this Flash as a token of gratitude; I managed to find it in that anomaly. Prepare yourself carefully… When night comes, we’ll head over to the factory.
I’ve already been at the factory, actually.
Oh, don’t mess around. Do you have any evidence?
Yeah. Here’s something I found there.
No.
And here I was, hoping for something better… Thank you for clearing up the situation, it seemed dangerous there. I have nothing to repay you with… except for my shotgun. I don’t need it anymore.
Don’t bother me.
Explore the complex
Return
Kill the controller
Speak to Fatty
Return to the village
Tonight, Fatty is going with you to investigate the mysteries of the factory complex. Finishing the search before morning would be prudent.
Well, I’m ready.
Great, I just can’t wait to discover all the secrets of this place. But be alert, I hope we will manage without incidents.
Hmm…

It’s always like this, you know? I almost died again and you saved me… Again. But there was nothing there… Well, mate, here’s your moral: rely only on objective and diversified information, draw the damn parallels, and don’t look at the world through rose-tinted glasses. Ugh!
What’s next?
Will you give me the documents? I’ll keep them as a souvenir, after the attacks. I have nothing to repay you, but I can become your good friend if you want to wander with me.
Yes, here, they are useless to me.
Are you kidding me or something? I risked my life because of you, three damn times. It’s better if I sell them to Barman.
Got any thoughts?
Let’s check out that PDA. There might be something useful on it. I don’t think they’ve touched it.
I think we should check out the three-story administrative building in the middle of the complex, in addition to the workshops.
Right? Let’s scout it. Maybe the stalkers left behind some traces while they were still kicking. I just don’t wanna stay around here for too long. Got a bad feeling about this…
None at the moment.
Find the heckler
Kill Alpha
Someone has been harassing Fatty, who now wants this person gotten rid of.
What else do you need help with?
A little while ago, some twat from the village came by and tried winding me up ’cos of my looks. Could you pay him a little visit?
How am I going to take him out? If I’m spotted, I’m done for.

They won’t know, trust me. I heard he’s looking for some help with raiding the area. Just find him and tell him you’re a stalker interested in some work, then lead him to a few bandits or mutants. They’ll turn him into Swiss cheese. You in? I can’t offer you anything personally, but anything on his corpse will be yours.
Let’s do it.
Don’t you find that a bit excessive? No, thanks.
Hey, nice camp you’ve got here. I was planning a trip and needed someone to cover my back.
Eh? Do I know you? Whatever, sure, stalker. Let’s go. I feel like having fun, and I’m getting bored just sitting around here anyway!
Okay, let’s move.
PDA of a Crystal member

Tens of files filled with strange and incoherent information, from which can be gathered that the members of this squad were from the world’s best military services. They had likely supervised the experiments carried out at the nuclear power plant before and after the first emission, later becoming zombified.
PDA of a Crystal member
This device is worn out beyond repair, without resorting to extreme measures.
PDA of a Crystal member

‘The great Monolith said It was in danger; the brothers were spread out and put on alert. No one is expressing any thoughts about the situation happening outside, so today, we will have to kill or die. For the sake of the Monolith, I will do it.’
PDA of a Crystal member

Nothing remarkable is stored in the memory of the device, except for one single note, dated June 2012:\n \n‘The last few days, the Monolith has stopped appearing in my dreams. Instead, I have begun to see episodes from the life of someone else… perhaps even mine. Is It testing my will? Is my faith in It not strong enough? Then I am ready to demonstrate to It my steadfastness, because today, the day has come: the day when tens, dozens, hundreds of fools will try to get close to Its effulgence. Today, they shall learn the power of the guardians of the Monolith.’
PDA of a Crystal member

This device appears to have belonged to a member of the Monolith, who was already engaged in several activities other than patrolling. Within is a description of a ‘revelatory room’ in which the brains were fixed by ‘infidels’. Furthermore, a description of ‘mysterious visions’ most likely resembles an image broadcast through a monitor. In addition to the previously unknown zombifying waves of the Brain Scorcher, the owners of this place did not hesitate to use methods of direct indoctrination in their future soldiers, through their ‘TV’. A method old as the world, but more effective here.
PDA of a Crystal member

‘We’ve loaded the bodies into the truck and gave out the devices with instructions as the storm was raging. At last, we’ve handed the vehicle over to the brotherhood; the Monolith will tell them where It wants them. I saw the face of a man with a scar… I believe I have encountered him before at some point.’

I need to be
Then I’ll continue on my own, and I’ll be taking that money. What a shame.

Fatty:\nOh, thank you! Here, I’ll open the door!
Fatty:\nGoddamn, what a horror… Who are they? Let’s see if they’ve left any traces.

Fatty:\nLet’s get out of here, quick!
Hatchet:\nStalker, you are in the territory of the Syndicate. You won’t be attacked, but we expect proper behaviour of you. If you’re looking for work, I may have a few things for you.
Prospector suit

This prototype suit is a modified version of the popular Sunrise suit. Its main advantages can be attributed to the reduced weight of both the body armour and the clothes in the set, as the rubber within is trimmed to the hems, if not removed entirely. It also stores an additional container for artefacts. Unfortunately, due to the corners cut to reduce the weight, this suit does not perform well in combat, but it will help in hunting for artefacts on the initial path of becoming a stalker.
OTs-14 Groza
This Groza is the result of experimentation by a Zone tech, resulting in it wearing down the barrel twice as quickly. As a remnant of the Crystal group, it may be of importance to Inquisitor.

Spare parts left from a disassembled sniper rifle.
Oh, hey, mate! You gonna show us some of that local action? Go ahead, we’ll follow your lead! We’re always ready to have some fun.
Need anything? Are we doing everything right?
Thank you. We won’t be forgetting your help, and if we ever reach the Wish Granter, we’ll also be making your life a sugary one. Goodbye, my friend!
Mm-hmm.
What can you tell me about Cold?
What can I say? He’s earned quite a bit of respect as the current leader of our organisation.
How did he earn that respect?

You see, there was some controversy regarding Lebedev, our former leader—who, by the way, I personally never met—and he didn’t seem to take the opinions of the faction members into account during their reckless crusade towards the CNPP. That mercenary certainly helped us out, but in the end, it just wasn’t worth it. Those who remained at the base were unable to fight back against a resurgence made by the renegades. The significance of our struggle in the swamps was reduced to zero… and the sacrifices here and on the way to the Chernobyl NPP turned out to be in vain.
It seems like the faction’s resentment towards their leader at that time was justified.

There’s more to it. After our troops managed to return, we had to start a long conflict to take everything back. We wouldn’t be able to manage in day-to-day life without Cold. He rallied up a number of unaffiliated stalkers and got in touch with folks throughout the Garbage and the Cordon. Free stalkers helped us out, and having a charismatic leader certainly didn’t hurt. Moreover, he’s given an order to all fighters, without exceptions, not to leave this place. We’ll take any help, but we won’t continue risking the lives of our guys.
Whoever Lebedev was and what he did, you don’t seem to be the same faction as you used to be.
That’s your opinion; certainly has some value to it. Right now, we have no large-scale goals, nor any common ideology… Anyway, it’s probably time we cut the storytelling and start the trading.
Deal.
Whose pseudodog is that?
That’s Buddy, the Doctor’s dog. Doctor asked Cold to keep him safe, as he’s started getting a little old.
Well, by the looks of it, you wouldn’t say that he needs protection.
Looks can be deceiving sometimes. Buddy is a kind-hearted creature. Now, can I tell you about these dogs and answer your questions?
Go ahead.
Pseudodogs aren’t really dogs at all, they actually originate from wolves. Duty found that out while researching them.
That’s… I need to write that down. What’s the request, anyway?

By virtue of my profession, I collect all sorts of stories. To the north, there’s a place similar to our swamps, called Zaton. I hear there’s an old crank living in the old barge, and if the rumours hold true, he also has a pseudodog. Perhaps you can find out if it’s true, if travelling that far won’t be a problem for you.
Ok, I will check it out.
Tell me about yourself.

I used to be stationed at the Agroprom Research Institute before I got a promotion. Before the Zone came into existence, I was a car mechanic. Duty noticed my skills as a handyman after I had been around for a while, so they decided to assign me as technician here. I prefer tinkering with heavy firearms and assault weapons… Hate working on marksman rifles.
What’s with the bottles? Didn’t think Duty allowed for drinking.

Duty lets me drink on duty… he-he. Bloody hell, it’s hard getting by without a few bottles… The work is pretty damn tedious, and boring. I wish I could go back to the Agroprom, but our base there is gone now. I don’t even know if I’d be alive if they had never relocated me. They say the base was lost during an emission in 2011… Huh, looks like we’ve gone way off topic. Anyway, don’t be shy now. Show me your toys if you need ’em fixed.
I’ll see if I have anything.
Who are you?

Congratulations! With a memory like that, you’ll be the next Strelok. Now listen carefully. I’m the big dog here, and you will know my name. I got here from Zaton some time ago along with my guys. We fucked the mutants out of the base and got it back up and running. Some sod set us up, pretended to be one of us and ratted me out. Had to get the hell out.
These rooks don’t even know the rules, copping the made guys like that. Whatever that twat’s name was, I’m gonna rip him a new one.
His name was Sashenka or something, and stay out of his ass. Your prick can’t be any larger than my pinky, and his asshole’s a metal maze.
Got it. Any tips on other groups in the Zone?

Simple. Don’t trust anybody but our guys with skulls on their sleeves. Pretty much everyone else is hostile; remember that. Just try to figure things out for yourself. If you feel something’s off, get your arse out of there.
Got it. Any safe places I can stay?

No such thing as a safe place in the Zone, boy, but don’t let this advice go to waste. North of us is the truck cemetery, and our boys there control the old checkpoint and the entrance to the army warehouses. Try not to hang around the cemetery at night, and stay away from all the old vehicles. Radiation levels there are high enough to make your counter ring down to your goolies, and that’s not even mentioning the creatures and anomalies. There’s the Garbage to the west; total chaos over there, and there’s a checkpoint to the north controlled by Duty. South of us is a forest called the Darkscape. Really wild place. You’ve got soldiers patrolling there from time to time and loners pissing about. Pretty big maze. Also, there are a few stalkers at the farm on the way to the Darkscape, so don’t fuck around. There’s a huge advantage in that forest: the road leads to the Cordon. You’ll easily find our guys at the vehicle station there.
Some scary information you’ve got.
And what did you expect, lad? No sunshine and rainbows. This is the real life.
Alright, whatever. Thanks for the help, boss.
Hey, Barman. I visited the factory in the Meadow and found some documents. Interested?

Come on, let’s see what the hell you got… Well, this is something only armchair generals or collectors will appreciate. You can safely bin these pieces of paper. But for solving the mystery of the plant: well done. That’s worth a few roubles.
Anything interesting going on in this bar?

Other than Russian roulette, you mean? I happen to be running a lottery. You need to bring me as many rare patches as possible from stalkers around the Zone, and I’ll give you a random prize. If you bring ten, there’s only gonna be a fifty-fifty chance of getting anything, and even then, the reward ain’t gonna be that big. But if you manage to find a whooping fifty patches: oooh, boy! Other than that, there’s a bigger demand for patches from scientists and Monolithians, so you can get even more for that; it’s a complete win-win. Oh, and Freedom patches won’t count, ’cause I’ve already got plenty.
What are you going to do with those patches?
Gonna sew myself a blanket out of them! You sure got a lot of questions, pal.
What kind of place is this?

Ain’t got a clue, have you? All I know is that there’s rubbish, rubbish, and more rubbish. This shitty place is stuffed with radiation and all sorts of thugs. There’s a large depot right to the right of the road, and you’re better off not going there, ’cause there’s a bandit base. That’s about all I know.
And what if Voronin finds out about your presence here?

Don’t mess with me, stalker, as that could very well be life threatening for you. And where’s the evidence to support your words? That’s right, you don’t have any. Get going while we still remain kind-hearted to you.
Who are you?

I’m a local informant, and I can offer you all kinds of services. At the moment, I’ve got different types of information, and maps with routes to various locations. Don’t ask me where I got this stuff.
Any free info can you share about the surrounding area?
Usually, info is how I make a living, but since everything’s quiet anyway, I can give you a bit of insight.
I’m all ears.

Well, you’re in Rostok. It’s completely safe for anyone on good terms with Duty. To the west lies the Wild Territory, the former western part of the Rostok factory. Rumours advise against going there at night. The best kill zones are held by the mercs, so you’ll likely be getting shot from two sides. There are mutants in the lower lands, and it’s better to find and stay on high ground, or stay by the warehouses… although, the mercs have those covered. That’s all about the Wild Territory. To the north lie the army warehouses, held by Duty’s ‘best friend’, Freedom. There’s nothing particularly interesting going on there, but it’s the last shelter around for sane people. To the east is the truck cemetery; stock up on anti-radiation supplies and ammo if you’re going there. There are a lot of mutants and sometimes the radiation is way past what even we consider to be normal. To the south is the Garbage… Complete anarchy going on over there. You’ve got mutants and thugs, but you’ve also got a neat marketplace. That’s all for the roundabouts, need anything else?
You mentioned something about a shelter for sane people?

Well, north of the warehouses is the Radar, an eerie place held by the Monolith. If you’re heading there, best stock up on ammunition and supplies. Let’s just say that it’s not the friendliest place you’ll come across.
Thanks for the info.
Hey, mate, thank you so much. The door’s rather flimsy and the bloodsucker would’ve turned me into bones.
No problem. How did you end up in here, anyway?
I know this sounds cheesy, but I was looking for something to profit on.
Have you found anything?
You bet! I’ve stashed some loot in the attic. You can head up there and take it as a token of gratitude. Listen, if you don’t have anything important going on, I’ve got an offer for you.
So what are mercenaries doing here?

We’re stuck, mate. We can’t continue forward for obvious reasons, and we can’t retreat, either. On top of that, all the paths are cut off, but that could be a positive: if we return to Dushman, he’s gonna tear our balls off and shove them right down our throats anyway.
What happened?

We were carrying out some kind of assignment for our client, but screwed up bad. The military eliminated most of our guys and scoured the nearby laboratory for any information… I really don’t feel like chattering about this. If you’re looking for work, I’ve got some.
You’re a guide, right?

That is the case; I know a couple of paths from here thanks to a stalker. They say one of our squads wanted to get rid of him, but fortunately, he ain’t mad at us for that. And, the sewer network here is quite well developed. My list goes as follows: the CNPP, Pripyat, Yanov in Jupiter, the Radar, the Pripyat underground, and Zaton, through Garry.

Gatekeeper:\nYou wanna get to Limansk? You’ll have to pay. Fortunately, you won’t have to pay much; only with the heads of a few chimeras hiding in that tunnel. Deal with them, and we might consider letting you through… he-he.
Gatekeeper:\nYou got ’em? Alright, we’ll lower the bridge. Those flying abominations have been bothering us for who knows how long. You’re welcome to trade supplies with us.

I’ve changed my mind.
Greetings, Sparrow.
Hello.
How are you?
I’m good, if a bit worn. Never thought I’d voluntarily end up in the Monolith.
What’s your story?

I’ve spent lots of time in the Zone. Used to dwell around the Bar. Last time I was there, I made a mistake and got wasted while the whole Radar went shambolic. All the ensuing chaos got interesting: soldiers scurrying about, loners around the area, Monolithians completely exhausted. I came across a bunch of guys from the Monolith, except that, by some miracle, they weren’t shooting at me. I helped them out a bit, decided to go to their base, and I got used to it there.
Why did you decide to remain?

I just can’t leave the Zone behind. I’ve had thoughts of going elsewhere, but as I remember the Great Land with all its unemployment and lack of prospect and any self-will, I just can’t bring myself to do it. Even in a place like this, I feel more accomplished. Anyway, we’ll have more time to chat later, if we survive.
Good luck.
You’re Pegasus, right?
Yeah. Hey, there. Did you wanna get acquainted?
Yeah. How did you end up here?

I crossed the army blockade and ended up here, and I’d rather keep the details to myself. It’s a bit personal. Besides that, the C-Consciousness is going to lead me to my dream. I’ve been one of the top marksmen in Wings, even though I myself don’t particularly fancy sniper rifles.
What is the C-Consciousness?

You really haven’t heard about them? Some might dismiss them as a myth, but I know for sure that they’re a group of expert scientists who somehow came into the noosphere. I managed to visit their laboratory in the north of the Zone, and let me tell you, they’ve got some fine technology: holograms, computers, other advanced equipment… It’s difficult to believe that it’s the result of combining modern Ukrainian inventions with old Soviet technology. And, you know, I’d rather be around those who inspire a bit of confidence, rather than some messed-up Dutyers.
You must be Wind.
Yes.
Anything you want to share about yourself?
No.
Alright?…

Find two controller brain tissues

Hello again! For some time, I’ve been attempting to research psy-emissions, and I would like your assistance. No particular mental activity will be required from you, rather, the brain of a controller… or, two, if you will?
Excellent, please show them! Rather unpleasant, isn’t it? That’s just my job, however. Thank you for the help! Oh, and here’s your reward.
Clear the area
Scientists and military forces are in need of your help in protecting Yantar.

Could you help us with clearing out zombified stalkers? They’ve been an irritation for a long time. It was dreadful prior to the recruitment of additional security. Cries, moans, the sound of nails scratching metal… Bah, no matter. If you help us, I can share one of several artefacts that stalkers have brought here with you. Will you assist us?
Excellent. Now, all that remains for us is to conduct an educational programme for the idiotic masses moving into the Zone and any other psy-emissive areas.
Find the Compass artefact
Sakharov is in need of an artefact known as the Compass.

I, alongside the others working in this bunker, have all heard about a legendary type of artefact and its change of possession from one person to another. It’s called the Compass, and until now, it hasn’t occured to us to try to study it in person. Will you assist us in finding one?
Thank you for your assistance. You may have one of our best suits. I’m sure that it will save your life, likely more than once.
Escort the scientists
Sakharov has asked you to lead and escort group of scientists while they take measurements out in the field.

I need someone to cover our guys during routine measurements of abnormal activity. Looking back on your experience living in the Zone, I believe that you are ideal for this approach. Do you agree with my proposal?
Thank you, stalker. Here’s your reward.
Collect the bark of Red Forest trees
Sakharov has asked you to help with research on the local flora by going to the Red Forest for samples of bark.

For a long time we have been arguing about the level of abnormal and radioactive interference in the structure of vegetation, in particular the so-called Red Forest trees, but all our attempts to understand this are being broken by the insurmountable obstacles that our scientific groups had to face. Can you go there and take samples of the bark of the trees there for us? They say the most mutated are standing near the Symbiont anomaly. I will mark the location on your PDA.
Thank you so much! Have this, it’s what the scientific community is willing to offer.

Find the Gauss rifle
Cardan wants to acquire a Gauss rifle.

Yeah, got some. I used to work in the Zone before the first emission; we developed all kinds of weapons for military purposes, but after the blowout, we were evacuated and I quit my job altogether. I couldn’t even imagine that the work on improving our prototype might continue. Stalker, I need a gauss shooter. I held one in my hands when a stalker brought a broken one to me, but I want to try and improve it somehow, and for that, I’m gonna need some spare parts. Bring it for me, and I’ll start gathering batteries for it. Well, will you help me out?
